start.description:
Track your sleep, analyze patterns, and improve your sleep quality.

Let's get started with a quick setup. Type /help to see all available commands.
start.select_language: ğŸŒ Please select your preferred language:

onboarding.question_bedtime: What time do you usually go to bed? (HH:MM format, e.g., 22:00)
onboarding.question_waketime: What time do you usually wake up? (HH:MM format, e.g., 06:00)
onboarding.question_target_hours: How many hours of sleep is your goal? (e.g., 8)
onboarding.question_timezone: What is your timezone? (e.g., Europe/Tallinn, America/New_York)
onboarding.invalid_time: Invalid time format. Please use HH:MM format (e.g., 22:00)
onboarding.invalid_hours: Invalid hours. Please enter a number between 1 and 24
onboarding.invalid_timezone: Invalid timezone. Please enter a valid timezone (e.g., Europe/Tallinn)
onboarding.completed:
âœ… Setup completed! You're all set to start tracking your sleep.

Use /sleep when you go to bed and /wake when you wake up.

help.title: ğŸ“š Available Commands
help.commands_list:
/start - Initialize bot and configure preferences
/help - Show this help message
/language - Change interface language
/sleep - Start sleep tracking
/wake - Stop tracking and view statistics
/quality <rating> - Rate your sleep quality (1-10)
/note <text> - Add notes about your sleep
/stats - View and export your sleep statistics
